required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Differential Target Multiplexed Spinal Cord Stimulation
clinical_study.official_title: Differential Target Multiplexed Spinal Cord Stimulation: a Multicenter Cohort Study

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of the effectiveness of differential target multiplexed spinal cord stimulation for treatment of chronic back and leg pain. Additionally, a subgroup analysis will be performed to evaluate potential differences between paddle/surgical leads versus percutaneous leads.

primary_outcome.measure: Overall pain intensity with Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: The change between the baseline screening and the evaluation 1 month after DTM stimulation, 6 months and 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Overall pain, defined as a combination of back and leg pain, but not pain from other body parts, measured with the VAS (100mm)

secondary_outcome.measure: Back pain intensity with Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The change between the baseline screening and the evaluation 1 month after DTM stimulation, 6 months and 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Leg pain intensity with Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The change between the baseline screening and the evaluation 1 month after DTM stimulation, 6 months and 12 months
The change between the baseline screening and the evaluation 1 month after DTM stimulation, 6 months and 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Open question regarding the dosage, frequency and type of pain medication

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The change between the baseline screening and the evaluation 1 month after DTM stimulation, 6 months and 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: The functional disabilities will be assessed with the Oswestry Disability Index (ODI)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The change between the baseline screening and the evaluation 1 month after DTM stimulation, 6 months and 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Health related quality of life, evaluated with the EuroQol with five dimensions and 5 levels

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluated at 1 month, 6 months and 12 months of DTM SCS.
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will be asked to quantify the impression of change after treatment using the Patient Global Impression of Change scale (PGIC).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The change between the baseline screening and the evaluation 1 month after DTM stimulation, 6 months and 12 months
The change between the baseline screening and the evaluation 1 month after DTM stimulation, 6 months and 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Patient activation measure-13 (PAM) is a 13-item instrument which assesses self-reported behaviour, knowledge, and confidence for self-management of one's health.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The change between the baseline screening and the evaluation 1 month after DTM stimulation, 6 months and 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Work status is evaluated with a self-designed questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The change between the baseline screening and the evaluation 1 month after DTM stimulation, 6 months and 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: The Pain Catastrophizing Scale (PCS) will be used to measure the level of pain catastrophizing

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The change between the baseline screening and the evaluation 1 month after DTM stimulation, 6 months and 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: The Central Sensitization Inventory is used to measure symptoms of central sensitisation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The change between the baseline screening and the evaluation 1 month after DTM stimulation, 6 months and 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: The hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) will measure symptoms of anxiety and depression

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The change between implantation and evaluation at 1 month, 6 months and 12 months of DTM SCS
secondary_outcome.description: Postoperative healthcare expenditure will be investigated by self-reporting methods.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The data will be extracted from SCS implantation up to 1 month of SCS, from 1 month of SCS up to 6 months and from 6 months up to 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Based on the AdaptiveStim technology, the time spent in body postures can be recorded.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout study period
Evaluated after final SCS implantation
Registration at 1 month, 6 months and 12 months of DTM SCS

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of technical issues with regard to DTM SCS programming
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout study period
Registration at 1 month, 6 months and 12 months of DTM SCS
Evaluated at baseline visit
secondary_outcome.description: Self-constructed open question to evaluate patient expectations about SCS

arm_group.description: Patients will receive differential target multiplexed spinal cord stimulation

study_pop.textblock: Patients with chronic back and leg pain due to Failed Back Surgery Syndrome (FBSS)/Persistent Spinal Pain Syndrome type 2 (PSPS-T2), who will receive treatment with differential target multiplexed (DTM) SCS.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with severe chronic pain (> 5 on numeric rating scale, NRS) for at least 6 months due to FBSS (PSPS T2) and suitable for treatment with DTM SCS according to the treating physician
- Age > 18 years
- Patient has been informed of the study procedures and has given written informed consent
- Patient willing to comply with study protocol including attending the study visits
Exclusion Criteria:
- Expected inability of the patient to receive or properly operate the spinal cord stimulation system
- History of coagulation disorder, lupus erythematosus, diabetic neuropathy, rheumatoid arthritis, or morbus Bechterew
- Active malignancy
- Addiction to drugs, alcohol (>5 units per day) and/or medication
- Evidence of an active disruptive psychiatric disorder or other known condition that may impact perception of pain, compliance to the intervention, and/or ability to evaluate treatment outcome as determined by investigator
- Immune deficiency (e.g. HIV positive, immunosuppressive treatment)
- Life expectancy < 1 year
- Local infection or any other skin disorder at site of incision
- Pregnancy
- Other implanted active medical device

clinical_study.keyword: differential target multiplexed spinal cord stimulation
